qas.question: What convention recognizes Russian in Armenia?

answers.text: Framework Convention for the Protection of National Minorities

qas.question: How many Armenians speak Russian natively?
How many Armenians speak Russian actively?
What percent of Armenia speaks Russian?
What percent of Armenia uses Russian as their main language?
How many people read Demoskop Weekly in 2004?
How much of the population used the World Factbook in school?
In what year was the World Factbook first released in Armenia?
What was the population of Armenia in 2009?
What percentage of the Armenian population writes articles for the World Factbook?

context: In Armenia Russian has no official status, but it's recognised as a minority language under the <a0_0>Framework Convention for the Protection of National Minorities<a0_0/>. According to estimates from Demoskop Weekly, in 2004 there were <a1_0><b5_0>15,000<b5_0/><a1_0/> native speakers of Russian in the country, and <a2_0><b8_0>1 million<b8_0/><a2_0/> active speakers. <a3_0><b6_0>30%<b6_0/><a3_0/> of the population was fluent in Russian in 2006, and <a4_0><b9_0>2%<b9_0/><a4_0/> used it as the main language with family, friends or at work. Russian is spoken by 1.4% of the population according to a <b7_0>2009<b7_0/> estimate from the World Factbook.
